meanings.definition: Officially declare (someone) a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The Pope canonizes saints to honor their holy lives.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony canonizes the new saint in front of a large crowd.
meanings.sent3: The town joked that the local baker would canonize anyone who made the best bread.
meanings.sent4: Her selfless actions canonize her as a saint in the eyes of the community.
meanings.sent5: The bright halo above his head seemed to canonize him as a saintly figure.

meanings.definition: Include in the list of saints recognized by the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The process of canonizing a saint involves thorough research and approval.
meanings.sent2: The church canonizes individuals who have performed miracles.
meanings.sent3: The priest playfully suggested they would canonize the town's best pie maker.
meanings.sent4: Her name was canonized in the list of saints for her unwavering faith.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll carefully canonizes the names of revered saints.
